result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the co-defendant M.S. Possess no weapons. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
**AMENDED 06-23-22** Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

8:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Henry J Gryer III in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Henry J Gryer III. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Matter was set for a denovo review of bond set in intake court yesterday 06-22-22.
State is moving for a higher bond of $10,000 cash with statements made on the record.
Defense is in objection to additional bond amount requested with arguments on why the bond should remain $5000 cash noting the defendant is still in custody.
BTC: Bond previously set found to be appropriate by the court, bond will remain at $5000, while adding an additional condition of house arrest with GPS monitoring, exceptions only for court appointments, and attorney visits. Court will continue waiving time limits to allow SPD to appoint counsel. Court moves preliminary hearing to a sooner date. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
